winter.title: Ningen Doubutsuen
winter.synopsis: A story about a human zoo.
winter.background: Ningen Doubutsuen is based on a poem by Shuntarou Tanikawa (谷川 俊太郎, b. 1931). The film won the Special Jury Prize at Annecy in 1963 and the bronze award for animation at the 1963 Biennale in Venice. It also won the 1965 Oofuji Noburou Award.

winter.title: Ari to Kirigirisu
winter.synopsis: Puppet animated film based on the Aesop fable of the same name.

winter.title: Goman-hiki
winter.synopsis: Shorts made by Otogi Pro (later remade for TV as Doubutsu Mura no Monogatari).

winter.title: Omusubi Kororin
winter.synopsis: A Japanese folk tale adapted as a puppet animation.

titles.title: Mei Tou Nao He Bu Gao Xing
沒頭腦和不高興 (没头脑和不高兴)

winter.title: Meitounao He Bugaoxing
winter.title_japanese: 沒頭腦和不高興 (没头脑和不高兴)
title_synonyms: Mei Tou Nao He Bu Gao Xing
winter.synopsis:
No-brain is a forgetful boy and Unhappiness is unhappy for everything. When others worry about their future, they really become grownups at once to make careers as they wish. But they make a series of troubles. 

(Source: IMDb)

winter.title: Hong Yunya
winter.synopsis: A story about the war between communism and capitalism in China.

winter.title: Kirei na Boushi
winter.synopsis: Music video for the song Kirei na Boushi by Hiroshi Ashino that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. It is considered to be lost media.

titles.title: アラビアンナイト　シンドバッドの冒険

spring.title: Arabian Night: Sindbad no Bouken
spring.title_japanese: アラビアンナイト　シンドバッドの冒険
spring.synopsis:
This is a work by Toei Animation Co., Ltd. with screenplay by Tezuka Osamu in cooperation with novelist Kita Morio. Sinbad and a boy, Ali, are stowaways on the transport ship "Boulder," but they win their proper places on the ship after currying the favor of the captain. 
Then the beautiful princess Samir jumps on board to escape a wicked minister who wants to marry her, and Sinbad goes through a series of adventures to protect the princess. 

The story unfolds with ups and downs, full of dramatic episodes from the original story such as a rough-and-tumble battle with a strange bird that is guarding diamonds.

titles.title: おとぎマンガカレンダー

spring.title: Otogi Manga Calendar
spring.title_japanese: おとぎマンガカレンダー
spring.synopsis:
A continuation of Instant History.

(Source: Cartoon Research)
spring.background: Otogi Manga Calendar was broadcast Mondays through Saturdays by Tokyo Broadcasting System. After the conclusion of the series in 1964, episodes were rebroadcast on June 27, July 4, and July 11.

titles.title: たのしい文明史 鉄ものがたり

spring.title: Tanoshii Bunmeishi: Tetsu Monogatari
spring.title_japanese: たのしい文明史 鉄ものがたり

spring.title: Ookina Furudokei
spring.synopsis: The original rendition of the Japanese version of the 1876 song My Grandfather's Clock by American composer and songwriter Henry Clay Work that was broadcast on NHK's Minna no Uta program. It was performed by Sumito Tachikawa and the Nagato Miho Kagekidan Jidou Gasshoudan (Miho Nagato Opera Children's Choir) and featured artwork by Rokurou Taniuchi. Due to the copyright law of the time, price of film reels, and overwriting tapes, Ookina Furudokei from 1962 remains to be one that is missing its video tape, as such the music video is considered lost media.

spring.title: Ki no Ii Ahiru
spring.synopsis: Music video for the song Ki no Ii Ahiru by Bonny Jacks that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. It is considered to be lost media.

spring.title: Pinocchio no Uta
spring.synopsis: Music video for the song Pinocchio no Uta by Toshie Kusunoki that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. It is considered to be lost media.

summer.title: Otogi no Sekai Ryokou
summer.synopsis: Seven short films combined in one theatrical movie telling the story of Otogi's Studio voyage around the world.

summer.title: Ichi, Ni, San, ...
summer.synopsis: Music video for the song Ichi, Ni, San, ... by Toshie Kusunoki that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. It is considered to be lost media.

fall.title: Aru Machi Kado no Monogatari
fall.synopsis:
On a certain street corner, there live a girl and her bear doll; a mischievous mouse named Kanku-bouya; a sycamore tree; an old street lamp; a moth; and posters containing a bar girl, a violinist, and a pianist. They all strive for life, but the world may not allow them to flourish.

In Aru Machi Kado no Monogatari, will the inhabitants of the street corner be able to maintain their peaceful existences, or will war and tyranny plunge them into chaos?

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
fall.background: Winner of the 1962 Oofuji Noburou Award.

fall.title: Osu
fall.synopsis: A cat just wants some alone time with his girl, but is interrupted by his stressed owner. Can't those stupid humans just keep things like relationships simple?

titles.title: Warai Kawasemi ni Hanasu na yo
わらいかわせみに話すなよ

fall.title: Warai Kawasemi ni Hanasu na yo

fall.synopsis: A music video for the song "Warai Kawasemi ni Hanasu na yo" by Toshie Kusunoki (楠トシエ). Aired as part of NHK's Minna no Uta program.

fall.title: Santa wa Doko ni Iru?
fall.synopsis: Music video for the song Santa wa Doko ni Iru? by The Three Graces that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. It is considered to be lost media.
